fields.description:
Hi, While I was trying JIRA's REST API Browser in Administration section of JIRA, I wanted to test adding 1 new comment to an existing issue, through the REST API. I've selected "Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - REST Plugin" on the top left select box and then clicked (had to click twice) on "/issue/\{issueIdOrKey\}/comment". Then, I tested to see first if the GET method will work and it did. After that, I tried to see if the POST method will work, providing the same issue id as in the GET method, not changing the default post data in the box ("body": "Lorem ipsum ..."). After I clicked the "Execute" button, I've got an html page as a response, basicaly saying:

Cause:
javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Error parsing media type ', application/xml'

I've opened up the "Developer Tools" (using Google Chrome) and switched to the "Network" tab, to see the request and this is what the request looked like (pay attention to "Content-Type" header field): Request URL:http://localhost:2990/jira/rest/api/2/issue/TP-1/comment Request Method:POST Status Code:500 Internal Server Error Request Headers view parsed POST /jira/rest/api/2/issue/TP-1/comment HTTP/1.1 Host: localhost:2990 Connection: keep-alive Content-Length: 285 Accept: application/json, text/javascript, */*; q=0.01 Origin: http://localhost:2990 X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/27.0.1453.116 Safari/537.36 Content-Type: , application/xml Referer: http://localhost:2990/jira/plugins/servlet/restbrowser Accept-Encoding: gzip,deflate,sdch Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.8 { "body": "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Pellentesque eget venenatis elit. Duis eu justo eget augue iaculis fermentum. Sed semper quam laoreet nisi egestas at posuere augue semper.", "visibility": { "type": "role", "value": "Administrators" } } My version of JIRA is: v5.1.8#787-sha1:823790c but I'll test tomorrow if this issue is present in the latest jira 6.x too.
fields.summary: REST API Browser sending wrong Content-Type
Reduce amount of output sent to catalina.out

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33654].
  {panel}

By allowing the Edit action to be visible and editable as a transition in Jira Workflow we will enable

* Post actions on Edit
* Conditions for Edit
* Validations for Edit

I know that people can add an Edit transition that does not change status but this does not replace the default Edit action and also creates confusion -- two Edit buttons with different behavior.

So, Edit action should be editable but not removable from transition list.

By implementing this you will allow people to add important extra functionality to jira without requiring complex third party plugins.
 
Example:  copy one field to another field (before or after this field is updated) - this would allow to save previous value of a field
fields.summary: Edit action should be visible as a transition inside the Workflows
Filter by comment

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
# Try to create an issue from the create issue pop-up screen
# Select attachments on this screen (the attachments are displayed in a checklist)
# Select Create Another and create an issue
# Creating another issue now will fail due to attachments not being found

*Expected Results:*
After step 3, the check-boxes for each attachments should remain checked and the attachments should be saved to the issue after clicking create.

*Actual Results:*
After step 3, all the attachments are unchecked and after clicking the create button they are lost.

*Notes*
This can cause significant inconvenience to a user, especially if they are creating an issue with a lot of file attachments that may be pushed out of view by other issue fields or details on the screen, such that they can easily be unaware that their attachments have been unchecked and are lost after they click to submit the page.
fields.summary: Attachment files are lost after changing project or issue type on create issue pop-up screen

*Problem:* 
* Creating Application Link between Atlassian's Application does not work if the application is running over SSL

*Diagnosis:*

Hi,

Due to some unexplained cause, we have found that our JIRA Charting plugin was not recording average time in status (ATIS) data and date of first response (DOFR) because the necessary custom fields were never active on the system.  Others have mentioned this issue in answers.atlassian; I don't think that it's been officially addressed; however, we've made the necessary additions for these charts to _start_ generating data.

The problem, then, is that our existing projects have no historical data to work with in order to populate these charts.

The formats of these custom fields are simple maps of durations or transition times between states.  As such, it would _seem_ as if it should be simple to make a utility that would do the following:

* Expose a function that allows an administrator to re-generate the custom field data for a project:
** Based on the recorded activity of the issue, which exists in the database
** The admin can by default choose not to include issues where that data exists
* Ideally, it would be nice for this not to cause X notifications of changes.
fields.summary: [JIRA Charting] Add mechanism to re-generate ATIS and/or DOFR field data

These customers seem to have latest version of UPM plugin.

See details from one customer in https://tempoplugin.jira.com/browse/JTMPO-862

fields.description:
In Jira you can translate your custom transition by specifying two properties:
jira.i18n.submit and jira.i18n.title

In previous versions the value of the property "jira.i18n.submit" was used for the submit-button in the opsbar when viewing an issue.

Since 5.x (at least since 5.2) this doesn't seem to be the case anymore. Instead the (mostly overlong) value of the property "jira.i18n.title" is used.

If this is a wanted behaviour, please add another property like "jira.i18n.label", that is displayed in the opsbar instead.

We found this issue in 5.2.10. It's probably also in previous versions.
fields.summary: Custom transition title-value is displayed in opsbar instead of submit-value since 5.x

Also there are already quite a few requests which are marked as duplicates of JRA-1604 which is marked as 'Resolved' which is wrong since it is not resolved (as in that functionality is not available up to 6.0.2).

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33605].
  {panel}

At the moment, custom field option has a limitation of 255 characters. And due to this, this actually opens the possibility for customer to configure a long String as an option for a custom field.

However when configuring a long String as an option for a custom field (eg: Select List custom field), the custom field value is truncated in the Issue Navigator (Basic Search). Please see the following sample screenshot for more details of this behavior:
!scshot.png!

This behavior basically affects the usability of the Issue Navigator Basic Search, especially if we have more than one long options for a custom field.

It will be great if we can format the custom field option 'popup' so that a long custom field option is displayed properly in the Issue Navigator Basic Search.

This behavior is tested in JIRA 5.2.6 and JIRA 6.0.1.
fields.summary: Long custom field options are truncated in the Issue Navigator

fields.description:
When upgrading JIRA and connect database with Oracle 11g, during the startup, it will show the following error in log file:
{noformat}
2013-06-22 09:56:51,094 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Could not create missing indices for entity "ReplicatedIndexOperation"
2013-06-22 09:56:51,094 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] SQL Exception while executing the following:
CREATE INDEX node_id_index_operation_time_idx ON replicatedindexoperation (NODE_ID, AFFECTED_INDEX, OPERATION, INDEX_TIME)
Error was: java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: ORA-00972: identifier is too long
{noformat}

JIRA is able to start up, so far all JIRA features seems working fine. Re-index in JIRA UI can be done successfully.

UPDATE: Also happens on a Fresh JIRA 6.0.2 installation connected to Oracle database and starting up.

h5. Workaround:
Referring to the [KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Upgrade+or+Installation+Fails+due+to+ORA-00972+identifier+is+too+long+Error] and make changes in entitymodel.xml or upgrade to JIRA 6.0.4

fields.description:
The Bulk Edit Group's multi-user picker only adds users to the group if you press the button. If you press "enter" inside the control, it submits the surrounding form. The problem with that is that there's three submit buttons in the form, and it doesn't send the right submit value to the server, so your input is all but ignored.

Pressing enter inside the multi-select control should cause the users to be added to the groups selected.

fields.description:
- I created a project with issues
- I added a bunch of sub tasks to the issues
- Then reconsidered because you can't see sub tasks in issues when planning a sprint
- I open each issue in a new tab and click "more -> Convert to task".  (Because I didn't know bulk chage existed)
- Once done, I went on with my business
- At the end of the day I checked the burndown and there was zero data, even though I could see the actual issues had time logged and remaining estimates had changed
- I scratched my head and Googled for a very long time
- I remembered I converted tasks above and tried doing a bulk change
- This fixed a few of the issues, but not all of them
- I've reindexed my system many many times and it doesn't help. 

Now I have two options: 
1. I re-do the entire project, all issues, all data for all issues, and re-log all the time entries at the dates they were added. (Hours of my time)
2. Some fixes this bug.

Here is a brief attachment: http://dev.kintek.com.au/jing/2013-06-21_1742.png

I was made to select version 5.1.4, but when I inspect it says 6.0-OD-15

I would prefer the latter.
fields.summary: Converting Sub Tasks to Task -> Time estimates and remaining time no longer shows in Burndown chart

h5. Summary
As of now, JIRA's Bulk Change for edit issues show all fields, whether or not the fields are related to the selected issues. That way, users might accidentally/mistakenly make changes to the fields that are not intended to be changed.

h5. Suggestion
To be able to have a Bulk Change in Project Level, such as in Project Administration page. With this, the Bulk Change will show only fields from the project, and disregard any unrelated fields.

Customer did a Security Scan on the instance and founded the version (5.1.8) that he is using subjected to security vulnerabilities on bundled tomcat which is version 6.0.35. 

Security Vulnerabilities Information:
* http://tomcat.apache.org/security-6.html#Fixed_in_Apache_Tomcat_6.0.36

So customer considering to upgrade to latest JIRA version (6.0.2). However the tomcat version that come bundled with it (7.0.29) is still exposed to security vulnerabilities as stated on the follow documentation from tomcat:

* http://tomcat.apache.org/security-7.html#Fixed_in_Apache_Tomcat_7.0.30

{quote}
*Important: Denial of service* CVE-2012-3544
When processing a request submitted using the chunked transfer encoding, Tomcat ignored but did not limit any extensions that were included. This allows a client to perform a limited DOS by streaming an unlimited amount of data to the server.

This was fixed in revisions 1378702 and 1378921.

This issue was reported to the Tomcat security team on 10 November 2011 and made public on 10 May 2013.

Affects: 7.0.0-7.0.29

*Moderate: DIGEST authentication weakness* CVE-2012-3439
Three weaknesses in Tomcat's implementation of DIGEST authentication were identified and resolved:

# Tomcat tracked client rather than server nonces and nonce count.
# When a session ID was present, authentication was bypassed.
# The user name and password were not checked before when indicating that a nonce was stale.

These issues reduced the security of DIGEST authentication making replay attacks possible in some circumstances.

This was fixed in revision 1377807.

The first issue was reported by Tilmann Kuhn to the Tomcat security team on 19 July 2012. The second and third issues were discovered by the Tomcat security team during the resulting code review. All three issues were made public on 5 November 2012.

Affects: 7.0.0-7.0.29

*Important: Bypass of security constraints* CVE-2012-3546

When using FORM authentication it was possible to bypass the security constraint checks in the FORM authenticator by appending /j_security_check to the end of the URL if some other component (such as the Single-Sign-On valve) had called request.setUserPrincipal() before the call to FormAuthenticator#authenticate().

This was fixed in revision 1377892.

This issue was identified by the Tomcat security team on 13 July 2012 and made public on 4 December 2012.

Affects: 7.0.0-7.0.29
{quote}

Customer requested this information to be conveyed here and to change the future bundled version to a later version to avoid on the security vulnerabilities stated.

Currently the only way to bypass this security threat is by deploying WAR installation with later version of tomcat.
fields.summary: Upgrade bundled Tomcat to the latest minor release

There are two things that are frustrating with the new search issue status code selection interface.    The example is selecting all status codes except for closed and on hold status codes.

1)  It is very frustrating trying to select multiple when the number of items is larger than the dropdown list since the list keeps reorganizing and you lose your position where you left when trying to select multiple items..

2) You need to keep scrolling back to select your next status value.

I attached a mp4 video showing the issue.

My personal suggestions are
1) Do not move the selection to the top of the list until the next time the dropdown list is opened.    The user continues selecting until either the user moves the user outside the dropdown area (for a long enough period of time or clicks outside the dropdown window.

2) or open the selection area showing all the status codes so no scrolling will be necessary

1) Provide an reverse selection similar to the clear selection to minimize the number of items that needs to be selected.
This is not an advanced item when you want to see all issues not closed.
fields.summary: using the status selection dropdown on the issue search screen is very frustrating

*Steps to reproduce:*

* Call the REST Search URL with quotes in the url:

bq. https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/search?jql=%22project+%3D+JRA+ORDER+BY+Key+ASC%22

*Expected Behaviour:*

Previously (against 5.2) this would return a valid result, stripping the quotes out.

*Actual Behaviour:*

{noformat}
{"errorMessages":["Error in the JQL Query: Expecting operator before the end of the query. The valid operators are '=', '!=', '<', '>', '<=', '>=', '~', '!~', 'IN', 'NOT IN', 'IS' and 'IS NOT'."],"errors":{}}
{noformat}

*Notes:*

A similar query was being used against EACJ without issue and last ran successfully in April. When tried against EACJ now it fails. Removing the quotes works fine:

https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/search?jql=project+%3D+JRA+ORDER+BY+Key+ASC

*Workaround:*

Remove the quotes manually
fields.summary: JIRA Rest API Fails to strip quotes correctly

fields.description:
I've noticed that some pages in JIRA are not validating properly, so I figured I might suggest JIRA core developers to use an HTML validator browser extensions in order to detect possible issues early in the development process and save time in the future finding and fixing those.

For example, a simple new plugin (servlet) with an empty velocity template and decorated with atl.admin decorator, produces around 20 html errors which could have been spotted and fixed, I hope.
fields.summary: HTML Validation of the core JIRA

fields.description:
When configuring a Webhook in JIRA, specifying an invalid IP address, the following WARN message will be recorded in JIRA logs file each time issues in the related project(s) is/are transitioned to a new status:
{noformat}
2013-06-18 20:29:11,775 Thread-24 WARN      [webhooks.util.http.CachingHttpContentRetriever] Unable to post information to 'http://172.0.0.123/user' as user 'null' due to: null
{noformat}

This behavior is tested in:
- JIRA 5.2.11
- JIRA 6.0.1

Steps to reproduce the problem:
- Access JIRA 5.2.11 or JIRA 6.0.1
- Configure a Webhook, using an invalid IP address, eg:
{noformat}
URL: http://172.0.0.134/user
Last Updated By: admin
Last Updated: 18/Jun/13 8:40 PM
Exclude details: No
JQL: All issues
Events: All issue events
Transitions: No linked transitions.
{noformat}

It will be great if the WARN message is changed to a more specific error, such as "can't connect to server", etc.
fields.summary: Improve Webhook WARN message if the IP address configured in the Webhook configuration cannot be reached

fields.description:
JQL gives wrong suggestions for the following Date fields: 
"created", "createdDate", "updated", "updatedDate", "resolved".

It should suggest only functions which return Date type, not User. Details on attached screenshoot. 
It is confusing especially for fields "created", "updated", "resolved" "because at the beginning I thought that it returns me issues created, updated, resolved by someone and it is not true. Besides, what is the difference between "created" and "createdDate"?
fields.summary: JQL gives wrong suggestions for Date fields

fields.description:
The tab ordering is incorrect

-Issue 1: When I am in the context of a criteria, tab ordering should start that where I have focus instead today tab ordering begins at the start of the page- (x) Will not Fix as it causes problems with users being unable to use shortcuts on page load and instead have to click esc or unfocus the query.

-Issue 2: When I tab into each filter in favourite filter, we take to the menu for that filter instead of to the filter itself. We should first tab to the filter and then to the menu for that filter- Confirmed fixed by Eric and Penny

-Issue 3: When tabbing over to the share, tools and views functionality we tab first to Share and then to permalink. From a screenreader perspective, we should tab first to the perma link and then to the share functionality- We don't have permalink any longer.

Issue 4: When a searcher is open and you click tab on the last tabbable element in the searcher the searcher should be closed and the clause button focused again. Should also do the same when shift tabbing on the first element.
fields.summary: The tab ordering within Issue Navigator is incorrect

fields.description:
It looks like viewing an issue (standalone, list view, detail view) no longer updates the current project. From [FEEDBACK-12048|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FEEDBACK-12048]:

{quote}Why do we now need to enter a full issue number to get to an issue?
I used to be able to just type in "/1467<ENTER>" on any screen and be taken to that issue. Now I need to do "/SCL-1467<ENTER>" which is a lot longer and completely negates the "Quick Search" feature. This has changed in the last few days.{quote}

Steps to reproduce:
* click the "Projects" menu and take note of the current project (let's call this CURRPROJ)
* run a search that returns issues from multiple projects (e.g. JRA, JRADEV, VMAC)
* keep pressing 'j' until you are viewing  an issue from a project other than the current project (let's call this NEWPROJ)
* click the "Projects" menu

Expected:
* the current project is NEWPROJ
* typing 123 in QuickSearch takes you to NEWPROJ-123

Actual:
* the current project is CURRPROJ
* typing 123 in QuickSearch takes you to CURRPROJ-123
fields.summary: viewing an issue in the issue nav does not update current project

fields.description:
Seen on Add Comment in Details View, using Chrome

Sometimes the drop down is located right below the comment textarea, sometimes it is located at the bottom-right corner, even for the same input (check 0:11-0:12, random placement for the same input '@a'). Its position is usually restored when clicking the horizontal scroll bar, but that is not always true.
fields.summary: Random placement of mentions dropdown

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Do any search
# Open any issue in a new tab
# Press 'j'
# Check browser's console
fields.summary: JS Error: "Cannot call method 'nextIssue' of undefined" pressing 'j' on an issue

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Go to any issue
# Edit any field that supports mentions (i.e. Description)
# Start to write a mention but do not select any user (i.e. type '@a')
# Press ESC to cancel the inline edit

Actual result: Mentions drop down is still visible
Expected result: Mentions drop down should be closed
fields.summary: Mentions drop down remains visible after pressing ESC to cancel inline edit
Icon for Archiving and Unarchiving versions no longer appears unless you pass the mouse over it.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33534].
  {panel}

From JIRA 4.4.5 (if I'm not wrong -- JIRA 5.0.x already has this feature) it is possible enabling the mail logs without adding _-Dmail.debug=true_ to the JIRA Startup Options. It can be done on _Administration -> Troubleshooting and Support -> Logging & Profiling -> Enable Debug Logs_ (for both Incoming and Outgoing mail servers).

The following page only apply to JIRA 4.4.4 and earlier versions:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+email+protocol+details

Please update it. 

Best regards,
Lucas Timm
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Update documentation about enabling the JIRA Mail Logs
Include DVCS connected repositories on JIRA Source tabs.
